alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 10:07AM CST until February 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following bayous in Louisiana... Bayou Dorcheat At Lake Bistineau affecting Webster, Bossier, Red River and Bienville Parishes. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat At Lake Bistineau. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 143.0 feet, Water begins to flow over Louisiana 164. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 142.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CST Thursday was 143.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 142.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 142.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 142.9 feet on 01/08/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1015 AM CST.
